Helpful resources for microbial genomics¶

If you were not able to follow the video, here is the link to illumina Sequencing¶

[HOME]

General Bioinformatics resources - Omictools - Bioinformatics One-liners by Stephen Turner - QC Fail: Explaining your errors

Short read processing - FastQC - Trimmomatic: Home Manual - bwa - bowtie - samtools - vcftools - bcftools - gatk - picard - SPANDx - Snippy

Genome assembly - Spades - Velvet - Mira - A5

Genome alignment - Mauve - MUMmer - Mugsy

Visualization of genomic data - Artemis - Artemis Comparison Tool - IGV

Genome annotation - Prokka - Blastall - LS-BSR

Phylogenetic tools and resources - Visualization - Seaview - iTOL - Figtree - Phylogenetic software - PAUP - RaxML - PhyML - BEAST - PHYLIP - APE - Microreact - Recombination detection - Gubbins - ClonalFrame - List of Phylogeny Programs

Databases - ARDB - PATRIC

Video Resources you should watch and follow - FastQC - NHGRI - Broad Institute - Cold Spring Harbor Lab - NCBI - Bioinformatics courses from MIT - Youtube Channel of Rafael Irizarry covering various topics on NGS analysis and statistics involved in it.

**101 Questions:** a series of interviews with notable bioinformaticians

Bioinformatics is just like bench science and should be treated as such

Unix/Command line - command-line bootcamp - Code academy
